effect: Ablative Armor functions as and stacks with Armor but, every time you are Hit or Crit by an Attack that deals damage (even if your Armor reduces that damage to 0), reduce the Ablative Armor by 1 to a minimum of 0.

A Condition caused when a creature receives wounds that bleed heavily. At the start of each of a creature's turns they take True Damage equal to their current Bleed value. A character's Bleed value decreases by 1 at the end of each of its turn. A character may also spend Grit at the end of a turn to reduce Bleed by 2 for every 1 Grit spent.

A Condition caused when a creature cannot maintain their guard. While a creature has any instances of Exposed, all Attacks against them have Advantage. A character clears 1 Exposed after being Attacked, and clears 1 more at the end of their turn.

A Condition caused when a creature's movement is impaired somehow. While a creature has any instances of Hobbled, their Moves are reduced by one level (i.e. a Reposition would become a Step). A character clears 1 Hobbled at the end of each of their turns.

A Condition caused when a creature's ability to attack is impaired. While a creature has any instances of Impaired, their Attacks have Disadvantage. A creature clears 1 Impaired after attacking, and clears 1 more at the end of their turn.

A Condition caused when a creature is vulnerable to attacks. The next time a creature with Vulnerable takes damage they take an additional amount of damage equal to their Vulnerable value, then clear all Vulnerable.
The next time a Wounded creature would gain Endurance from any source, they instead remove 1 Wound.
